identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study to Assess Safety & Effectiveness of Tovinontrine in Chronic Heart Failure With Reduced Ejection Fraction (Cycle-1-REF)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Dose Finding Study to Assess the Safety and Effectiveness of Tovinontrine in Patients With Chronic Heart Failure With Reduced Ejection Fraction

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of tovinontrine compared to placebo to lower NT-proBNP in patients with chronic heart failure with reduced ejection fraction.

conditions: Heart Failure With Reduced Ejection Fraction

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in biomarkers from Baseline to Week 12 - NT-proBNP
primaryOutcomes.description: The percent change in plasma NT-proBNP (Dose Cohort 3 versus placebo) will be calculated from Baseline to Week 12 using an ANCOVA model. If a statistically significant reduction in plasma NT-proBNP is detected (2-sided alpha=0.05), the next analysis will compare Dose 2 versus placebo at the (2-sided alpha = 0.05 level). If statistically significant, the next analysis will compare Dose 1 versus placebo.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in biomarkers at Week 12 by treatment group - NT-proBNP
secondaryOutcomes.description: The percent change in plasma NT-proBNP will be calculated by treatment group from Baseline to Week 12. The correlation of plasma concentration with percent change in plasma NT-proBNP will be evaluated using Pearson's correlation coefficient.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in biomarkers at week 12 by treatment group - cGMP
secondaryOutcomes.description: The percent change in urine and plasma cGMP from Baseline to Week 12 will be analyzed using ANCOVA and MMRM models by treatment group.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in biomarkers at week 12 by treatment group - BNP
secondaryOutcomes.description: The percent change in BNP from Baseline to Week 12 will be analyzed using an ANCOVA model to evaluate individual dose comparisons.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in the biomarker ratio at Week 12 - NT-proBNP
secondaryOutcomes.description: The change in the urine and plasma cGMP to NT-proBNP ratio at week 12 will be calculated for each treatment group

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in the biomarker ratio at Week 12 - BNP
secondaryOutcomes.description: The percent change in the urine and plasma cGMP to BNP ratio from Baseline to Week 12 will be calculated for each treatment group

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire-23-Clinical Summary Score
secondaryOutcomes.description: Scaled 0 to 100 where lower scores represent worse health status than higher scores

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire 23- Overall Summary Score
secondaryOutcomes.description: Scaled 0 to 100 where lower scores represent worse health status than higher scores
Class I to IV are possible with a higher classification representing worsening heart failure status

The number of participants with TEAEs including drug related AEs, serious AEs (SAEs), and AEs leading to study drug discontinuation will be assessed. The incidence of AEs will be presented by system organ class and preferred term according to the Medical Dictionary of Regulatory Activities.

Number of participants with normal/ abnormal values at Baseline compared to normal/ abnormal values post-Baseline will be assessed for hematology, serum chemistry and urinalysis. Descriptive statistics of clinical laboratory assessment results and the change from Baseline will be presented by dose cohort and visit.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in vital sign measurement: systolic and diastolic blood pressure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change from Baseline to Week 12 will be assessed for systolic and diastolic blood pressure (mmHg). Descriptive statistics of vital signs and the change from Baseline will be presented by dose cohort and visit.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in vital sign measurement: pulse rate
secondaryOutcomes.description: The change from Baseline to Week 12 will be assessed for pulse rate (bpm). Descriptive statistics of vital signs and the change from Baseline will be presented by dose cohort and visit.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in vital sign measurement: respiratory rate
secondaryOutcomes.description: The change from Baseline to Week 12 will be assessed for respiratory rate (breaths/min). Descriptive statistics of vital signs and the change from Baseline will be presented by dose cohort and visit.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in vital sign measurement: body temperature
secondaryOutcomes.description: The change from Baseline to Week 12 will be assessed for body temperature. Descriptive statistics of vital signs and the change from Baseline will be presented by dose cohort and visit.

General physical exams will be carried out to detect any abnormalities in the cardiovascular, respiratory, and other body systems. Non-pre-existing abnormal physical examinations will be summarized by dose cohort and visit.

Number of participants who have normal/abnormal 12-lead ECG measurements at Baseline will be compared to normal/abnormal 12-lead ECG measurement post Baseline. Descriptive statistics of 12-lead ECG data and the change from baseline will be presented by dose cohort and visit.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Assessment of pharmacokinetics (PK): PK effect on NT-proBNP
secondaryOutcomes.description: The plasma concentrations will be evaluated in the PK Population. The plasma concentration of tovinontrine will be summarized by dose cohort and visit. The correlation of plasma concentration with percent change in plasma NT-proBNP will be evaluated using Pearson's correlation coefficient.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Assessment of pharmacokinetics (PK): PK effect on plasma cGMP
secondaryOutcomes.description: The plasma concentrations will be evaluated in the PK Population. The plasma concentration of tovinontrine will be summarized by dose cohort and visit. The correlation of plasma concentration with percent change in plasma cGMP will be evaluated using Pearson's correlation coefficient.

overallOfficials.name: Gail Berman
overallOfficials.affiliation: Senior VP Head, Clinical Development Cardurion
